member.name: M:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ISequentialInStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes data to 7-zip packer
member.param: Array of bytes available for writing
member.remarks: If (size > 0) and there are bytes in stream, this function must read at least 1 byte. This function is allowed to read less than "size" bytes. You must call Read function in loop, if you need exact amount of data.

member.name: T:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ISequentialOutStream
member.summary: 7-zip ISequentialOutStream imported interface

member.name: M:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ISequentialOutStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Writes data to unpacked file stream
member.param: Array of bytes available for reading
member.remarks: If size != 0, return value is S_OK and (*processedSize == 0), then there are no more bytes in stream. If (size > 0) and there are bytes in stream, this function must read at least 1 byte. This function is allowed to rwrite less than "size" bytes. You must call Write function in loop, if you need exact amount of data.

member.name: T:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs
member.summary: The arguments passed to .
member.remarks: For each file, is first called with set to . If the callback chooses to extract the file data by setting or , the callback will be called a second time with set to or to allow for any cleanup task like closing the stream.

member.summary: Information about file in the archive.
member.value: Information about file in the archive.

member.name: P:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs.Reason
member.summary: The reason for calling .
member.remarks: If neither nor is set, will not be called after .

member.name: P:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs.Exception
member.summary: The exception that occurred during extraction.
member.remarks: If the callback is called with set to , this member contains the _Exception that occurred. The default behavior is to rethrow the _Exception after return of the callback. However the callback can set to null to swallow the _Exception and continue extraction with the next file.

member.name: P:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs.CancelExtraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the extraction.
member.value: true to cancel the extraction; false to continue. The default is false.

member.name: P:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs.ExtractToFile
member.summary: Gets or sets whether and where to extract the file.
member.value: The path where to extract the file to.
member.remarks: If is set, this mmember will be ignored.

member.name: P:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.ExtractFileCallbackArgs.ExtractToStream
member.summary: Gets or sets whether and where to extract the file.
member.value: The the extracted data is written to.
member.remarks: If both this member and are null (the defualt), the file will not be extracted and the callback will be be executed a second time with the set to or .

member.summary: Gets or sets any data that will be preserved between the callback call and the or calls.

member.name: F:BestCS.Compression.SevenZip.SevenZipLibraryManager._libraryFileName
member.summary: Path to the 7-zip dll.
member.remarks: 7zxa.dll supports only decoding from .7z archives. Features of 7za.dll: - Supporting 7z format; - Built encoders: LZMA, PPMD, BCJ, BCJ2, COPY, AES-256 Encryption. - Built decoders: LZMA, PPMD, BCJ, BCJ2, COPY, AES-256 Encryption, BZip2, Deflate. 7z.dll (from the 7-zip distribution) supports every InArchiveFormat for encoding and decoding.
